[[Sun Life Stadium]] | playoffs = | pro bowlers = | uniform = | next = [[2012 Miami Dolphins season|2012]] }} The '''[[2011 NFL season|2011]] [[Miami Dolphins]] [[List of Miami Dolphins seasons|season]]''' will be the team's 42nd season in the [[National Football League]], the 46th overall and the fourth under head coach [[Tony Sparano]].http://www.nfl.com/news/story/09000d5d81d84147/article/sparano-told-hell-stay-with-dolphins-despite-harbaugh-talks?module=HP_headlines The Dolphins made their first round selection with the 15th pick of the [[2011 NFL Draft]] on [[Florida Gators football|Florida]] [[offensive lineman]] [[Mike Pouncey]]. {{TOC limit|3}} ==Offseason== ===2011 NFL draft=== {{Main|2011 NFL Draft}} DraftKing.com, NFLMocks.com, and ''The Palm Beach Post'' predicted that the Dolphins would use their first round pick to choose [[Gabe Carimi]], a left tackle for the Wisconsin Badgers who won the 2010 [[Outland Trophy]] as the nation's top collegiate interior lineman, and was a Consensus All-American.{{cite web|url=http://nflmocks.com/2011/02/16/mock-my-mock-1st-round/ |title=1st Round Â« NFL Mocks | Covering the 2011 NFL Draft |publisher=Nflmocks.com |date= |accessdate=February 18, 2011}}{{cite news|url=http://blogs.palmbeachpost.com/thedailydolphin/2011/03/15/mock-draft-v-20-predicting-the-first-round-of-the-2011-nfl-draft/ |title=Mock Draft v. 2.0: Predicting the first round of the 2011 NFL Draft |work=The Palm Beach Post |author= Ben Volin |date=March 14, 2011 |accessdate=March 18, 2011}} Charles Davis of NFL.com predicted they would draft [[Mark Ingram, Jr.]] from the University of Alabama.{{cite news|url=http://www.nfl.com/news/story/09000d5d81e9431a/article/postcombine-projection-has-panthers-taking-aim-at-newton |title=Post-combine projection has Panthers taking aim at Newton |publisher=Nfl.com |date=March 2, 2011 |author=Charles Davis |accessdate=March 18, 2011}} {| class="wikitable" style="font-size: 95%;" |- ! 4 || 111 | [[Edmond Gates]] || [[Wide receiver|WR]] || [[Abilene Christian Wildcats|Abilene Christian]] || 6'1" || 192 || |- ! 6 || 174 | [[Charles Clay (American football)|Charles Clay]] || [[Fullback (gridiron football)|FB]]/[[Tight end|TE]] || [[2010 Tulsa Golden Hurricane football team|Tulsa]]||6'3"||235|| align="center"| {{#tag:ref|The Dolphins traded its sixth-round selection (#179 overall) and seventh-round selection (#218 overall) to the [[Green Bay Packers]] for their sixth-round selection (#174 overall) and seventh-round selection (#231 overall).|group=dr}} |- ! 7 || 231 | [[Frank Kearse]] || [[Defensive tackle|DT]] || [[Alabama Agricultural and Mechanical University|Alabama A&M]] ||6'4"||315|| align="center"| {{#tag:ref|The Dolphins acquired this seventh-round selection (#218 overall) in a May 2010 trade that sent [[Guard (American football)|G]] [[Justin Smiley]] to the [[Jacksonville Jaguars]].|group=dr}} |- ! 7 || 235 | [[Jimmy Wilson (American football)|Jimmy Wilson]] || [[Cornerback|CB]] || [[Montana Grizzlies football|Montana]] ||5'11"||185||align="center"| {{#tag:ref|[[National Football League Draft#Compensatory picks|Compensatory selection]]|group=dr}} |} ====Draft notes==== {{reflist|group="dr"}} ===Personnel changes=== [[Brian Daboll]] joins the team as [[offensive coordinator]]. [[Karl Dorrell]] moves to quarter backs coach from wide receivers coach. [[Jeff Nixon]] added as the running backs coach. [[Steve Bush]] moves to wide receivers coach from offensive quality control. [[Ike Hilliard]] added as an assistant wide receivers coach. [[Dan Campbell]] moves to tight ends coach from intern. [[Bryan Cox]] is added as a defensive pass rush coach. ===Roster changes=== ====Re-signings==== *'''March 4''' â Re-signed guard [[Richie Incognito]] three years http://www.palmbeachpost.com/sports/dolphins/dolphins-resign-lineman-richie-incognito-place-free-agent-1296300.html *'''July 30''' â Re-signed defensive tackle [[Tony McDaniel]] two years http://www.thephinsider.com/2011/7/28/2299444/dolphins-wednesday-recap *'''August 5''' â Re-signed offensive tackle [[Nate Garner]], running back [[Lex Hilliard]], tackle [[Lydon Murtha]], running back [[Kory Sheets]]http://insidepulse.com/2011/08/09/nfl-team-transactions-from-august-as-of-august-8-1000-pm-et/ ====Signings==== *'''July 26''' â Signed quarter back Terminated contracts with corner back [[Will Allen (cornerback)|Will Allen]], nose tackle [[Ronald Fields]], running back [[Larry_Johnson_(American_football)|Larry Johnson]], full back [[Lousaka Polite]], and tackle [[Ray Willis]].http://www.miamidolphins.com/news/dolphins-trim-roster-53-players *'''September 4''' â Waived defensive tackle [[Frank Kearse]] *'''September 5''' â Released linebacker [[A._J._Edds|A.J. Edds]] and terminated the contract of center [[Joe Berger]] *'''September 8''' â Waived guard [[Ray Feinga]] *'''September 13''' â Terminated the contract of corner back [[Benny Sapp]] *'''September 20''' â Terminated the contracts of running back [[Larry_Johnson_(American_football)|Larry Johnson]] and tight end [[Dante Rosario]]. *'''September 28''' â Cut defensive end [[Ryan Baker]] ====Trades==== *'''July 29''' â Traded reserve safety [[Jonathon Amaya]] and an exchange of undisclosed draft picks for running back [[Reggie Bush]]. http://espn.go.com/nfl/story/_/id/6811714/new-orleans-saints-reggie-bush-agrees-contract-miami-dolphins-trade ===Team Captains=== The team voted the following as their 2011 [[Team_captain|team captains]]. from Chad Henne (Dan Carpenter kick), ''Patriots 38â24'', '''''Drive: 8 plays, 74 yards, 2:05''''' |stats= ;Top passers * NE â [[Tom Brady]] - 32/48, 517 yards, 4 TDs * MIA â [[Chad Henne]] â 30/49, 416 yards, 2 TDs ;Top rushers * NE â [[Danny Woodhead]] - 14 rushes, 69 yards * MIA â [[Chad Henne]] â 7 rushes, 59 yards, 1 TD ;Top receivers * NE â [[Wes Welker]] - 8 receptions, 160 yards, 2 TDs * MIA â [[Brandon Marshall]] â 7 receptions, 139 yards ;Top tacklers * NE â [[Devin McCourty]] - 10 tackles, 1 assist * MIA â [[Reshad Jones]] â 8 tackles, 4 assists }} The Dolphins began their 2011 campaign at home, for a Week 1 AFC East duel with the [[New England Patriots]] in the first game of [[Monday Night Football]]'s doubleheader. Miami delivered the game's opening splash with a 9-yard touchdown run from quarterback [[Chad Henne]]. The Patriots answered with running back [[BenJarvus Green-Ellis]] getting a 4-yard touchdown run. New England took the lead in the second quarter as quarterback [[Tom Brady]] completed a 10-yard touchdown pass to tight end [[Rob Gronkowski]]. The Dolphins struck back in the third quarter as Henne found wide receiver [[Brian Hartline]] on a 10-yard touchdown pass, but New England came right back with Brady completing a 2-yard touchdown pass to wide receiver [[Wes Welker]]. Miami replied with a 20-yard field goal from kicker [[Dan Carpenter]], but the Patriots came right back with Brady completing a 1-yard touchdown pass to tight end [[Aaron Hernandez]]. New England added onto their in the fourth quarter as kicker [[Stephen Gostkowski]] got a 20-yard field goal, followed by Brady completing a 99-yard touchdown pass to Welker. The Dolphins would close out the game with Henne finding running back [[Reggie Bush]] on a 2-yard touchdown pass. With the loss, Miami began their season at 0-1. ====Week 2: vs. Houston Texans==== {{Americanfootballbox |titlestyle= {{NFLPrimaryColor|Miami Dolphins}}; {{NFLSecondaryColor|Miami Dolphins}};text-align:center; {{NFLSecondaryColor|Miami Dolphins}};text-align:center; |state=autocollapse |title= Week Ten: Washington Redskins at Miami Dolphins â Game summary |date=November 13 |time=1:00 p.m. EST |road=Redskins |R1=3|R2=3|R3=3|R4=0 |home='''Dolphins''' |H1=7|H2=3|H3=3|H4=7 |stadium=Sun Life Stadium, Miami Gardens, Florida |attendance=57,007 |weather=79Â° F, Mostly Cloudy |referee=[[Carl Cheffers]] |TV=[[NFL on Fox|Fox]] |TVAnnouncers= [[Chris Myers]] & [[Tim Ryan (American football)|Tim Ryan]] |reference= |scoring= ;First quarter ;Second quarter ;Third quarter ;Fourth quarter |stats= ;Top passers * WAS â * MIA â ;Top rushers * WAS â * MIA â ;Top receivers * WAS â * MIA â ;Top tacklers * WAS â * MIA â }} ====Week 11: vs. Buffalo Bills==== {{Americanfootballbox |titlestyle= {{NFLPrimaryColor|Miami Dolphins}}; {{NFLSecondaryColor|Miami Dolphins}};text-align:center; |state=autocollapse |title= Week Eleven: Buffalo Bills at Miami Dolphins â Game summary |date=November 20 |time=1:00 p.m. EST |road=Bills |R1=3|R2=3|R3=0|R4=2 |home='''Dolphins''' |H1=14|H2=14|H3=7|H4=0 |stadium=Sun Life Stadium, Miami Gardens, Florida |attendance=57,531 |weather=80Â° F, Mostly Cloudy |referee=[[Walt Coleman]] |TV=CBS |TVAnnouncers=[[Marv Albert]] and [[Rich Gannon]] |reference= |scoring= ;First quarter * BUF â [[Dave Rayner]] 30 yard field goal, ''Bills 3â0'', '''''Drive: 9 plays, 70 yards, 4:47.''''' * MIA â [[Anthony Fasano]] 10 yard reception from [[Matt Moore (American football)|Matt Moore]] ([[Shayne Graham]] kick), ''Dolphins 7â3'', '''''Drive: 12 plays, 87 yards, 6:45''''' * MIA â [[Reggie Bush]] 5 yard run (Shayne Graham kick), ''Dolphins 14â3'', '''''Drive: 4 plays, 59 yards, 1:40.''''' ;Second quarter * MIA â [[Charles Clay]] 12 yard reception from Matt Moore (Shayne Graham kick), ''Dolphins 21â3'', '''''Drive: 5 plays, 23 yards, 2:09''''' * MIA â [[Davone Bess]] 4 yard reception from Matt Moore (Shayne Graham kick), ''Dolphins 28â3'', '''''Drive: 5 plays, 4 yards, 0:32''''' * BUF â Dave Rayner 56 yard field goal, ''Dolphins 28â6'', '''''Drive: 8 plays, 39 yards, 1:36.''''' ;Third quarter * MIA - [[Lex Hilliard]] recovered blocked punt in the end zone (Shayne Graham kick), ''Dolphins 35-6'' ;Fourth quarter *BUF - [[Daniel Thomas (American football)|Daniel Thomas]] tackled in end zone by [[Kelvin Sheppard]], Safety |stats= ;Top passers * BUF â * MIA â ;Top rushers * BUF â * MIA â ;Top receivers * BUF â * MIA â ;Top tacklers * BUF â * MIA â }} Coming off their win over the Redskins, the Dolphins stayed at home for a Week 11 AFC East showdown with the [[Buffalo Bills]]. Miami trailed early in the first quarter as Bills kicker [[Dave Rayner]] made a 30-yard field goal, yet the Dolphins immediately answered with quaterback [[Matt Moore (American football)|Matt Moore]] finding tight end [[Anthony Fasano]] on a 1-yard touchdown pass, followed by a 5-yard touchdown run from running back [[Reggie Bush]]. Miami would add onto their lead in the second quarter with Moore connecting with fullback [[Charles Clay]] on a 12-yard touchdown pass, followed by wide receiver [[Davone Bess]] on a 4-yard touchdown pass. Buffalo would close out the half with Rayner booting a 56-yard field goal. The Dolphins continued their dominating day in the third quarter with running back [[Lex Hilliard]] recovering a blocked punt in the endzone for a touchdown (the team's first TD off of a blocked punt since 1990). The Bills tried to rally as linebacker [[Kelvin Sheppard]] tackled rookie running back [[Daniel Thomas (American football)|Daniel Thomas]] in the endzone for a safety, but Miami's lead proved to be too much to overcome. With the win, the Dolphins improved to 3-7. This game also marked the first time since 1990 that Miami allowed 10 points or fewer in three-straight games. They have now become the 3rd team in NFL History to win 3 straight after starting season at least 0-7 ('78 Cardinals & '86 Colts).[http://thefinsiders.com/blog/2011/game-recap-dolphins-35-bills-8] ====Week 12: at Dallas Cowboys==== '''[[Thanksgiving Classic]]''' {{Americanfootballbox |titlestyle= {{NFLPrimaryColor|Miami Dolphins}}; {{NFLSecondaryColor|Miami Dolphins}};text-align:center; |state=autocollapse |title= Week Twelve: Miami Dolphins at Dallas Cowboys â Game summary |date=November 24 |time=4:15 p.m. EST/3:15 p.m. CST |road=Dolphins |R1=3|R2=3|R3=10|R4=3 |home='''Cowboys''' |H1=0|H2=10|H3=0|H4=10 |stadium=[[Cowboys Stadium]], [[Arlington, Texas]] |attendance=87,418 |weather=Played indoors (retractable roof closed) |referee=[[Pete Morelli]] |TV=CBS |TVAnnouncers=[[Jim Nantz]] & [[Phil Simms]] |reference= |scoring= ;First quarter ;Second quarter ;Third quarter ;Fourth quarter |stats= ;Top passers * MIA â * DAL â ;Top rushers * MIA â * DAL â ;Top receivers * MIA â * DAL â ;Top tacklers * MIA â * DAL â }} Coming off their win over the Bills, the Dolphins flew to [[Cowboys Stadium]] for a Week 12 interconference duel with the [[Dallas Cowboys]] on Thanksgiving. Miami delivered the game's opening punch in the first quarter with a 26-yard field goal from kicker [[Shayne Graham]], but the Cowboys answered in the second quarter with kicker [[Dan Bailey (American football)|Dan Bailey]] getting a 32-yard field goal, followed by quarterback [[Tony Romo]] completing a 5-yard touchdown pass to wide receiver [[Laurent Robinson]]. The Dolphins would close out the half with a 28-yard field goal from Graham. Miami would regain the lead in the third quarter with a 27-yard field goal from Graham, followed by quarterback [[Matt Moore (American football)|Matt Moore]] fiding wide receiver [[Brandon Marshall]] on a 35-yard field goal. Dallas struck back in the fourth quarter with Romo completing an 18-yard touchdown pass to Robinson. The Dolphins would reply with a 23-yard field goal from Graham, but the Cowboys got the last laugh with Bailey nailing the game-winning 28-yard field goal. With the loss, Miami fell to 3-8. ====Week 13: vs. Oakland Raiders==== {{Americanfootballbox |titlestyle= {{NFLPrimaryColor|Miami Dolphins}}; {{NFLSecondaryColor|Miami Dolphins}};text-align:center; |state=autocollapse |title= Week Thirteen: Oakland Raiders at Miami Dolphins â Game summary |date=December 4 |time=1:00 p.m. EST |road=Raiders |R1=0|R2=0|R3=0|R4=14 |home='''Dolphins''' |H1=6|H2=7|H3=21|H4=0 |stadium=Sun Life Stadium, Miami Gardens, Florida |attendance=57,225 |weather=80Â° F, Sunny |referee=[[Mike Carey (American football)|Mike Carey]] |TV=CBS |TVAnnouncers= [[Greg Gumbel]] & [[Dan Dierdorf]] |reference= |scoring= ;First quarter ;Second quarter ;Third quarter ;Fourth quarter |stats= ;Top passers * OAK â * MIA â ;Top rushers * OAK â * MIA â ;Top receivers * OAK â * MIA â ;Top tacklers * OAK â * MIA â }} ====Week 14: vs. Philadelphia Eagles==== {{Americanfootballbox |titlestyle= {{NFLPrimaryColor|Miami Dolphins}};
